question:
SCENARIO: Your team is working on a critical project with a tight deadline. Two days before the delivery, you discover a significant bug that could take 8-10 hours to fix properly. A quick workaround exists but may cause issues later. Your manager is unaware of this problem.

QUESTION: What is the BEST course of action?
option1: Implement the quick workaround and deliver on time without mentioning the issue
option2: Immediately inform your manager about the bug and recommend extending the deadline
option3: Fix the bug overnight without telling anyone to avoid blame
option4: Document the workaround and plan to fix it in the next sprint

question:
SCENARIO: During a team meeting, your colleague presents an idea that you recognize as very similar to a solution you shared informally with them last week. They don't acknowledge your contribution, and your manager seems impressed.

QUESTION: How should you handle this situation?
option1: Interrupt immediately and publicly call out that it was your idea
option2: Wait until after the meeting and privately discuss this with your colleague
option3: Send an email to your manager afterward claiming credit for the idea
option4: Let it go to maintain team harmony and avoid confrontation

question:
SCENARIO: You're assigned to work with a remote team member who consistently misses deadlines and doesn't respond to messages promptly. This is affecting your own deliverables and causing frustration.

QUESTION: What is the MOST professional approach?
option1: Complain about them to your manager and request a different team member
option2: Schedule a one-on-one video call to understand their challenges and discuss expectations
option3: Start documenting every instance to build a case against them
option4: Work around them and complete their tasks yourself to meet deadlines
